FuncDef:
The display local-bill cache command displays the information about specified bills in the local bill pool.
The display local-bill information command displays the configurations of the local bill function and the usage of the CF card or local bill pool.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the start serial number of bills in the local bill pool.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 49151.

Specifies the number of bills to be displayed.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 100.

ExtraInfo:
If a RADIUS server is configured to implement the accounting for access users or value-added services, the device allows the generation of local bills under the following scenarios:
An accounting stop request is triggered by a user or value-added service, but the RADIUS server does not respond. In this case, the Router generates a local bill to record the accounting information and considers that the user is offline.The accounting start-fail online command is run to allow a user to go online even if accounting fails to start for the user. When users go offline, local bills can be created to record accounting information.
When the function to generate local bills is enabled, run the display local-bill cache command to check the information about specified bills in the local bill pool.
When the function to generate local bills is enabled, run the display local-bill information command to check the configurations of the function and the usage of the CF card or local bill pool.
